desc_merge: A logistics firm must select quantities of various cargo types for shipping, where each cargo type has a weight [10, 3, 1, 5, 8, 9, 9, 10, 1, 2], a volume [4, 1, 2, 5, 5, 4, 4, 5, 4, 4], and a revenue [11, 16, 15, 16, 6, 17, 8, 10, 8, 17], with unlimited units available per type. The cargo plane has a maximum payload of 34 and a maximum cargo hold volume of 22. The objective is to maximize total revenue by choosing how many units of each cargo to load without exceeding the plane's dual constraints, which is crucial for operational profitability.

An investor decides on the number of shares to purchase for various assets, where each asset share has an associated risk weight [2, 5, 6, 2, 9, 9, 9, 6, 6, 1], a liquidity measure [2, 5, 1, 2, 5, 2, 5, 4, 3, 5], and an expected return [14, 15, 20, 11, 4, 14, 11, 19, 3, 2], with no purchase limit per asset. The investor's portfolio has a maximum risk tolerance 33 and a maximum liquidity constraint 20. The goal is to determine the optimal number of shares for each asset to maximize total expected return while adhering to both risk and liquidity limits, thereby optimizing the investment strategy.

A cloud provider allocates virtual machine instances from different categories to a server cluster, where each instance type consumes a certain CPU allocation [6, 10, 5, 6, 2, 10, 8, 10, 2, 9], a memory allocation [1, 3, 1, 2, 2, 4, 3, 3, 1, 4], and generates a profit [10, 11, 17, 14, 18, 2, 9, 1, 5, 7], with an unlimited number of each type available. The physical server hardware has a total CPU capacity 40 and a total memory capacity 14. The challenge is to select the quantity of each instance type to deploy to maximize total profit without surpassing the server's computational and memory capacities, ensuring efficient infrastructure utilization.

A manufacturing plant sources raw materials in bulk, where each material type has a cost weight [3, 4, 1, 1, 6, 6, 10, 10, 4, 2], a storage space requirement [4, 3, 5, 5, 2, 3, 5, 4, 4, 2], and a production value [12, 3, 10, 11, 2, 15, 14, 12, 6, 13], and can be procured in any quantity. The procurement budget imposes a cost limit 28 and the warehouse has a fixed storage volume 22. The aim is to determine the optimal procurement quantity for each material to maximize the total production value generated while staying within the budget and storage space constraints, which is vital for cost-effective manufacturing.

A catering company designs a menu for a large event by selecting dishes, where each dish option requires an ingredient cost [7, 8, 1, 4, 1, 2, 10, 2, 7, 7], a preparation space [4, 3, 5, 1, 5, 1, 5, 4, 5, 5], and has a customer satisfaction score [14, 14, 16, 12, 1, 2, 17, 7, 3, 4], with each dish being producible in unlimited quantities. The event has a total food budget 29 and a kitchen preparation area with a maximum space 22. The objective is to choose the number of portions for each dish to maximize the total satisfaction score for attendees without exceeding the budget or kitchen space, ensuring a successful event.

An airline needs to determine the optimal quantity of various cargo types to load onto a freighter aircraft, where each cargo type has a specific weight [5, 7, 7, 8, 9, 4, 7, 4, 8, 6], a space requirement [5, 1, 3, 1, 2, 5, 2, 4, 1, 4], and a revenue generated [11, 5, 16, 17, 10, 12, 11, 17, 9, 2], with an unlimited supply of each cargo type available for loading; the aircraft's cargo hold has strict maximum takeoff weight 39 and total volumetric space 16 limitations, and the objective is to maximize the total revenue from the transported cargo without violating either physical constraint, which is critical for operational profitability and safety compliance.

An e-commerce fulfillment center must decide how many of each product to pack into shipping containers for international shipment, where each product has a physical weight [5, 1, 4, 10, 6, 7, 8, 6, 7, 9], a packaging size [1, 1, 1, 3, 4, 1, 5, 3, 2, 5], and an associated sales value [18, 15, 4, 16, 14, 8, 15, 18, 4, 2], and items can be selected any number of times from inventory; the standard shipping containers impose a maximum allowable weight 37 and a fixed internal volume 15, and the goal is to maximize the total value of goods shipped per container while adhering to these dual restrictions, thereby optimizing logistics costs and delivery efficiency.

A farming cooperative plans the transport of harvested crops from fields to market, where each crop type has a bulk weight [4, 5, 9, 8, 4, 8, 7, 7, 7, 4], a storage bin volume [4, 5, 1, 4, 5, 2, 5, 1, 1, 5], and a market price per unit [17, 1, 12, 16, 9, 15, 13, 16, 7, 4], and crops are available in continuous quantities; the transport vehicles have a maximum load-bearing capacity 37 and a finite cargo area volume 19, requiring the selection of crop quantities to maximize the total market value of the load without exceeding the vehicle's structural or spatial limits, which directly impacts profitability and reduces spoilage.

A military logistics unit is tasked with loading supply pallets for an airdrop mission, where each supply type (like ammunition, medical kits, rations) has a weight [3, 6, 5, 1, 6, 10, 8, 6, 1, 4], a pallet footprint [1, 5, 3, 4, 2, 2, 3, 4, 1, 5], and a strategic value score [2, 5, 18, 7, 9, 7, 4, 11, 16, 13], and supplies can be included in any quantity; the cargo plane used for the drop has a critical maximum payload weight 30 and a limited bay volume 18, and the objective is to maximize the total strategic value of the delivered supplies while strictly respecting both aircraft performance constraints, ensuring mission success and troop support.

An aid organization assembles relief kits for disaster zones, where each resource item (such as water bottles, blankets, food packets) has a weight [4, 4, 1, 5, 3, 7, 2, 3, 10, 7], a packed size [5, 5, 4, 4, 3, 4, 5, 2, 2, 5], and a utility value [12, 8, 10, 9, 17, 19, 8, 11, 19, 16] reflecting its critical need, and items are available without quantity limits; the transportation method, often a helicopter or truck, has a strict maximum weight limit 27 and a cargo space limit 23, and the challenge is to determine the quantity of each resource to include to maximize the overall utility or aid effectiveness of the shipment, ensuring the most efficient use of limited transport capacity to help the maximum number of people.

A shipping company must determine how many containers of each cargo type to load onto a vessel, where each cargo type has a weight [4, 5, 1, 4, 2, 3, 9, 2, 3, 10], a volume [4, 5, 2, 3, 5, 3, 3, 3, 2, 2], and a shipping freight value [20, 6, 20, 12, 18, 18, 2, 19, 7, 13], and any cargo type can be loaded in multiple units. The vessel has strict stability and space restrictions defined by a maximum weight capacity 25 and a maximum volume capacity 19. The objective is to select the quantity of each cargo type to maximize the total freight revenue for the voyage without exceeding the ship's structural and spatial limits, which is vital for operational profitability and safety.

A construction firm needs to plan the delivery of bulk materials to a remote site, where each material type, like sand or gravel, has a per-unit weight [5, 10, 6, 1, 9, 3, 8, 10, 1, 5], a per-unit volume [3, 1, 4, 1, 1, 2, 5, 2, 5, 5], and a value [18, 9, 10, 12, 3, 16, 2, 20, 17, 4] based on its contribution to project progress, and materials can be ordered in any quantity. The transport vehicle has a maximum load weight 34 and a cargo hold volume 17. The aim is to calculate the optimal amount of each material to ship per trip to maximize the overall site productivity value while adhering to the vehicle's physical constraints, ensuring efficient use of each delivery run.

A content streaming service must decide how many copies of each movie or show to cache on a local server, where each title has a data size [3, 2, 8, 7, 1, 1, 10, 3, 7, 5], a processing memory footprint [5, 1, 5, 1, 3, 4, 2, 1, 5, 4], and an expected viewer engagement value [10, 19, 17, 2, 7, 3, 16, 12, 17, 19], and titles can be replicated without restriction. The server has a maximum storage capacity 28 and a RAM limit 18 for concurrent streaming. The goal is to choose the number of copies for each title to maximize the total user satisfaction value derived from fast access, without surpassing the server's storage and memory capacities, which optimizes streaming quality and service reliability.

A supermarket manager must allocate shelf space to various products, where each product has a weight [1, 5, 2, 2, 3, 4, 6, 10, 6, 10] representing handling cost, a volume [3, 4, 3, 1, 5, 3, 5, 4, 4, 5] for the space it occupies, and a profit margin [3, 3, 13, 14, 8, 4, 12, 13, 15, 15], and products can be restocked in unlimited quantities. The shelf unit has a maximum weight limit 29 for safety and a total available volume 22. The problem is to determine the quantity of each product to display to maximize total profit while respecting the shelf's weight-bearing capacity and spatial volume, directly influencing sales and inventory turnover.

A recycling facility processes different types of scrap materials, where each material type has a weight [7, 2, 4, 7, 9, 7, 4, 6, 7, 4], a bulk volume [4, 2, 1, 5, 3, 4, 5, 4, 5, 1], and a resale value [4, 9, 1, 1, 6, 15, 10, 3, 8, 19], and each type can be accepted in any quantity. The processing machinery has a maximum hourly throughput weight 34 and a maximum input hopper volume 20. The objective is to decide the quantity of each material type to process in a shift to maximize total resale value without exceeding the equipment's weight and volume processing limits, which is crucial for operational efficiency and profitability.

A streaming service must optimize its edge server content caching strategy, where each media file has a storage size [5, 5, 5, 4, 3, 5, 4, 3, 3, 2], a bandwidth consumption cost [4, 6, 9, 1, 1, 5, 3, 4, 6, 5], and a user demand-driven value [19, 10, 16, 15, 15, 18, 20, 17, 12, 3], with each file type being replicable without limit. The edge server infrastructure imposes a total storage capacity 23 and a maximum bandwidth threshold 26. The objective is to determine the optimal number of copies of each file to cache to maximize total user satisfaction and engagement metrics without exceeding the server's technical constraints, thereby ensuring low-latency streaming and efficient network utilization.

An automotive plant needs to plan its production of various car parts, where each part type has a raw material cost weight [2, 5, 8, 1, 7, 3, 1, 9, 2, 10], a required storage space [5, 4, 2, 1, 5, 3, 5, 1, 4, 5], and a profit contribution [20, 10, 3, 15, 8, 1, 9, 15, 2, 1], and any part can be manufactured in unlimited quantities. The factory's warehouse and budget for a production cycle have a maximum allowable total material cost 28 and a total physical storage limit 21. The goal is to select the quantity of each part to produce to maximize overall profit while adhering to both financial and spatial limitations, optimizing manufacturing throughput and inventory management.

An event organizer is allocating resources for different types of promotional booths at a trade show, where each booth design has a setup material weight [10, 6, 8, 8, 9, 10, 8, 5, 7, 7], a footprint area [5, 2, 5, 3, 5, 2, 4, 4, 5, 5], and an expected visitor engagement value [6, 8, 6, 10, 17, 5, 14, 4, 9, 17], with each design being available for unlimited deployment. The exhibition hall has a maximum floor load capacity 46 and a total available floor area 24. The problem is to decide how many units of each booth type to install to maximize total visitor engagement across the event without surpassing the hall's structural and spatial constraints, enhancing the overall exhibitor and attendee experience.

A university department is constructing a set of course modules for an online program, where each module has a student workload estimate [10, 6, 10, 9, 3, 9, 6, 3, 3, 7], a digital asset storage requirement [4, 4, 3, 4, 2, 4, 4, 2, 1, 3], and an educational value score [10, 16, 18, 9, 5, 12, 13, 4, 16, 16], and modules can be selected any number of times. The program must adhere to a maximum acceptable total student workload 39 and a server storage limit for course materials 18. The objective is to choose the number of instances for each module to include in the curriculum to maximize the total educational value delivered, while ensuring the program remains manageable for students and technically feasible to host.

A space agency is planning the instrumentation for a satellite mission, where each scientific instrument has a mass [1, 8, 1, 8, 2, 6, 1, 4, 3, 10], a physical volume [2, 3, 3, 2, 4, 3, 4, 1, 2, 4], and a scientific data return value [13, 8, 14, 7, 11, 6, 14, 13, 7, 2], with each instrument type being available for inclusion in multiple copies. The satellite bus has a strict launch mass limit 26 and a fixed payload bay volume 16. The goal is to determine the optimal quantity of each instrument to include to maximize the total scientific return of the mission, while complying with the stringent launch vehicle and spacecraft design constraints.

An automotive manufacturer needs to optimize continuous parts delivery to assembly stations where each component type has a handling weight [2, 3, 9, 1, 6, 7, 6, 2, 4, 6], storage space requirement [3, 5, 4, 1, 5, 2, 2, 5, 4, 5], and production line value [2, 14, 11, 10, 16, 12, 7, 12, 13, 14] per unit, with unlimited availability of each part. The automated delivery system has maximum load capacity 27 and spatial limits 21. The objective is to determine optimal part quantities for maximum assembly efficiency without exceeding physical constraints, ensuring uninterrupted production flow.

Cultural institutions must select artifacts for touring exhibitions where each piece has fragility-adjusted weight [5, 9, 9, 3, 5, 7, 8, 9, 3, 4], crating volume [4, 4, 4, 2, 1, 4, 1, 1, 3, 5], and cultural significance score [14, 2, 12, 10, 8, 14, 10, 15, 18, 14], with multiple identical artifacts available. Transport vehicles have strict weight 37 and space 17 restrictions. The challenge involves maximizing total cultural impact through artifact selection while preserving structural and spatial safety margins during transit.

Movie producers must allocate filming equipment where each gear type has transport weight [1, 4, 2, 5, 4, 6, 9, 5, 7, 2], storage bulk [1, 5, 3, 2, 3, 1, 3, 4, 1, 5], and creative utility value [18, 1, 7, 12, 17, 9, 8, 13, 4, 5], with unlimited rental availability. Production trucks impose weight 27 and volume 16 ceilings. The aim is to maximize on-set capability through optimal equipment combinations while maintaining mobility between shooting locations.

Chefs must source ingredients where each food item has shipping weight [5, 1, 2, 10, 6, 4, 5, 3, 10, 5], refrigeration volume [1, 3, 4, 4, 1, 1, 5, 1, 5, 5], and menu profitability [13, 1, 14, 16, 9, 13, 12, 6, 12, 6], with continuous supplier availability. Kitchen infrastructure limits include maximum cold storage weight 30 and spatial capacity 18. The optimization seeks to maximize culinary revenue through ingredient quantity selection while respecting preservation and space constraints.

Space agencies select experimental instruments where each device has launch mass [1, 8, 10, 8, 9, 3, 3, 4, 10, 1], payload bay volume [3, 1, 1, 4, 5, 2, 5, 4, 1, 2], and research value [5, 3, 13, 13, 6, 10, 4, 15, 14, 20], with multiple identical units available. Rocket configurations enforce strict mass 34 and volumetric 16 limits. The problem requires maximizing scientific return through instrument multiplicity decisions while adhering to launch vehicle physical specifications.

A city's sanitation department must determine the optimal number of vehicles to deploy for collecting different types of recyclable materials, where each vehicle type assigned to a material has a specific operational cost weight [2, 7, 10, 9, 2, 10, 5, 6, 6, 10], a spatial footprint [3, 1, 5, 3, 2, 4, 4, 2, 1, 1], and an environmental benefit score [11, 1, 20, 18, 9, 13, 9, 4, 1, 18], with each type being available for unlimited deployment. The municipal budget imposes a maximum total cost 40 and the available depot space sets a maximum total footprint 15. The objective is to select the quantity of each vehicle type to deploy to maximize the total environmental benefit without surpassing the financial and spatial limits, thereby enhancing the city's sustainability efforts.

A cinema chain needs to decide on the quantity of each snack and drink item to stock for a major premiere, where each product has a shipping weight [6, 2, 2, 7, 4, 5, 10, 6, 6, 2], a shelf space requirement [3, 4, 1, 5, 3, 3, 1, 4, 5, 3], and a projected profit margin [11, 3, 4, 7, 11, 18, 9, 17, 15, 2], and items can be ordered in unlimited quantities. The concession stand's storage area has a maximum weight capacity 30 for shelving and a total volume limit 19. The goal is to choose the number of units for each product to maximize total profit while adhering to the physical storage constraints, ensuring optimal sales potential.

A publishing company must decide the print run size for each title in its upcoming catalogue, where each book title has a paper weight [8, 5, 6, 3, 8, 4, 7, 1, 4, 8], a storage space requirement [3, 1, 1, 5, 4, 4, 1, 5, 5, 3], and an expected royalty value [19, 1, 17, 9, 10, 14, 20, 19, 11, 17], and any title can be printed in unlimited quantities. The warehouse facilities have a maximum supported weight limit 32 and a maximum cubic volume 19. The aim is to determine the number of copies to print for each title to maximize total royalty earnings without exceeding the warehouse's weight and volume capacities, optimizing inventory for demand.

An outdoor recreation company must select how many units of each type of gear (e.g., kayaks, tents) to include in its rental fleet, where each gear type has a transport weight [10, 4, 10, 7, 5, 5, 9, 8, 8, 7], a storage size [5, 3, 3, 3, 3, 5, 5, 4, 2, 2], and a rental income potential [19, 18, 1, 16, 13, 3, 9, 2, 10, 7], and any gear can be acquired without limit. The company's transport vehicle has a maximum payload 43 and the gear storage locker has a maximum volume 21. The objective is to choose the quantity of each gear type to maximize total rental income while complying with the vehicle and locker constraints, ensuring a profitable and versatile fleet.

A sports team manager needs to pack training and game equipment for an away fixture, where each type of equipment, such as balls, weights, or medical kits, has a physical weight [10, 7, 9, 6, 3, 6, 7, 6, 1, 9], a storage volume [13, 15, 14, 12, 3, 10, 7, 17, 8, 6], and an importance score [1, 2, 2, 2, 5, 2, 3, 3, 5, 4] reflecting its necessity for team performance. The team's transport vehicle has strict limits on total payload 38 and cargo space 17. The objective is to determine the optimal quantity of each equipment type to pack, as items can be taken in multiples, to maximize the total preparedness value without exceeding the vehicle's constraints, ensuring the team has all necessary resources for peak performance.

A logistics coordinator for a multi-day music festival must manage the supply of various vendor goods, where each good, like beverages, souvenirs, or food ingredients, has a per-unit weight [4, 7, 3, 6, 1, 9, 8, 1, 5, 10], a bulk volume [3, 1, 5, 2, 1, 2, 1, 4, 2, 4], and a profit contribution [11, 17, 10, 13, 20, 8, 10, 8, 4, 2]. Each good can be supplied in unlimited quantities from central warehouses. The delivery trucks servicing the festival grounds have maximum weight 32 and volume 15 restrictions. The goal is to calculate the number of units of each good to load per shipment to maximize total profit from vendor sales while adhering to the transportation limits, optimizing inventory flow and revenue generation.

A research team preparing for a remote wildlife conservation expedition must select scientific supplies, where each supply item, such as sensor traps, camera equipment, or sample containers, has a weight [4, 5, 4, 7, 1, 10, 10, 2, 7, 10], a packed volume [3, 5, 2, 5, 4, 1, 2, 2, 3, 2], and a research value [12, 12, 10, 8, 13, 3, 16, 19, 19, 10] based on its data yield potential. Supplies can be acquired in any quantity. The expedition's aircraft and ground transport have strict maximum weight 36 and storage volume 17 capacities. The aim is to choose the quantities of each supply item to maximize the total scientific value of the mission without surpassing the logistical capacities, ensuring comprehensive data collection.

A production manager for a touring theatrical company must plan the shipment of costume pieces and props, where each item category has a weight [5, 6, 8, 9, 6, 5, 5, 2, 10, 1], a packing volume [2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 5, 2, 5, 3, 3], and an artistic value [18, 6, 4, 17, 19, 5, 20, 12, 20, 5] critical to the show's integrity. Items within a category are identical and can be packed in any number. The touring trucks have fixed maximum weight 34 and cubic volume 18 limits. The challenge is to decide how many units of each costume or prop type to load to maximize the total production value delivered to each venue while complying with the transport constraints, guaranteeing a flawless performance.

An e-commerce fulfillment center must decide how many copies of each product to include in a shipment batch, where each product has a weight [1, 2, 3, 2, 2, 10, 10, 7, 10, 9], a storage volume [1, 4, 3, 3, 2, 5, 3, 1, 2, 4], and a sales value [12, 15, 1, 17, 20, 6, 18, 20, 19, 12], with each product type available in unlimited quantity from inventory. The shipping containers used for dispatch have a strict maximum weight limit of 33 and a maximum volume limit of 16. The objective is to determine the optimal quantity of each product to pack in order to maximize the total sales value of the shipment while ensuring the container's weight and volume capacities are not exceeded, thereby optimizing logistics efficiency and profitability per shipment.

A chemical plant needs to determine the number of batches for each chemical compound to process in a single production run, where each compound requires a raw material weight [3, 3, 5, 7, 1, 9, 8, 8, 10, 1], occupies a reactor vessel volume [4, 2, 4, 4, 1, 1, 1, 2, 5, 4], and has a market value [18, 10, 12, 9, 11, 18, 17, 3, 9, 7], and any compound can be scheduled for multiple batches. The production facility is constrained by a maximum allowable total weight 33 for raw material handling and a maximum total volume 16 that the reactor system can accommodate. The goal is to select the number of batches for each compound to maximize the total value of the output while adhering to the plant's safety and operational limits, ensuring optimal throughput.

A renewable energy company is installing components for a new farm, where each type of component (like a solar panel or wind turbine part) has a physical weight [8, 4, 5, 9, 1, 6, 3, 6, 2, 10], a spatial volume [1, 4, 1, 4, 3, 1, 5, 1, 2, 5], and an energy generation value [4, 1, 18, 20, 18, 20, 1, 19, 4, 3], with an unlimited supply of each component type available. The installation vehicle and the foundation have maximum load-bearing weight 32 and spatial volume 16 constraints. The problem is to choose how many units of each component to install in a single phase to maximize the total energy generation value without surpassing the structural and spatial limitations, thus optimizing the farm's initial output.

A moving company must decide how many items of each type (e.g., boxes, furniture) to load onto a truck for a client's move, where each item type has a weight [5, 3, 10, 7, 2, 1, 10, 7, 5, 10], a volume [4, 3, 1, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 3, 1], and a value [11, 9, 19, 14, 7, 14, 13, 1, 12, 15] based on the service fee, and multiple identical items can be loaded. The moving truck has a maximum payload capacity of 36 and a maximum cargo space volume of 14. The objective is to select the quantities of each item type to load to maximize the total service value for the trip while ensuring the truck's weight and volume limits are respected, leading to efficient and profitable job planning.

A library is allocating space on its high-performance servers for digitalizing collections, where each collection type (e.g., book scans, audio recordings) has a file size equivalent to weight [7, 6, 10, 6, 5, 2, 8, 9, 10, 1], a required processing memory footprint equivalent to volume [5, 2, 2, 3, 4, 3, 5, 2, 5, 2], and a research value [1, 4, 19, 9, 15, 7, 19, 20, 9, 3], and each collection can be digitized in multiple units. The server cluster has a maximum storage capacity 38 and a maximum simultaneous processing memory limit 19. The aim is to determine how many units of each collection type to process and store to maximize the total research value accessible, while staying within the hardware's storage and processing constraints.

In a role-playing game, players collect various types of loot items, where each item type has a weight [2, 8, 5, 4, 4, 9, 5, 4, 6, 4], an inventory slot size [5, 2, 2, 5, 2, 1, 3, 3, 2, 5], and a gold value [14, 14, 9, 6, 16, 3, 9, 1, 10, 16], and any item type can be collected an unlimited number of times. The player's character has a maximum carrying capacity of 30 for weight and an inventory grid with a total slot limit of 18. The challenge is to select the optimal combination of loot quantities to maximize total gold value without exceeding either the weight or slot constraints, thereby enhancing in-game wealth accumulation and resource management efficiency.

A regional food bank receives bulk donations of various food categories, where each category has a perishability weight [1, 8, 4, 7, 9, 10, 3, 4, 4, 7], a storage space requirement [2, 5, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1, 4, 3, 1], and a nutritional benefit score [12, 15, 12, 3, 20, 12, 3, 10, 1, 6], and each category can be accepted in unlimited quantities. The food bank's warehouse has a maximum weight handling limit of 34 and a total storage volume of 12. The objective is to determine the optimal acceptance quantities for each food category to maximize total nutritional benefit for the community while adhering to both weight and volume restrictions, ensuring effective hunger relief operations.

A film studio must stock its prop warehouse with various prop types for upcoming productions, where each prop type has a handling weight [9, 2, 5, 10, 3, 4, 4, 5, 4, 8], a shelf space occupancy [5, 3, 2, 5, 4, 1, 5, 2, 5, 5], and a reusable rental value [9, 13, 15, 19, 11, 7, 17, 8, 1, 13], and any prop type can be acquired in unlimited amounts. The warehouse infrastructure supports a maximum load capacity of 32 and a total storage volume of 22. The goal is to choose the quantity of each prop type to store to maximize total rental value across film projects without surpassing structural weight or spatial limits, optimizing asset utilization and cost-effectiveness.

A commercial nursery grows multiple plant species for sale, where each species has a soil weight [7, 7, 1, 5, 8, 3, 6, 3, 4, 2], a greenhouse space requirement [1, 1, 5, 3, 1, 4, 5, 5, 1, 5], and a market price [12, 5, 6, 1, 20, 14, 15, 9, 5, 7], and each species can be cultivated without quantity restrictions. The nursery's transportation vehicle has a maximum load weight of 27 and a cargo area volume of 18. The problem involves selecting the number of plants per species to transport to market to maximize total sales revenue while complying with both vehicle weight and space capacities, improving logistical efficiency and profitability.

A hospital's central storage must stockpile various medical supplies for emergency readiness, where each supply type has a weight [2, 3, 1, 9, 8, 3, 7, 9, 8, 5], a storage volume [1, 3, 4, 4, 5, 1, 5, 5, 1, 1], and a criticality value [2, 9, 20, 10, 5, 18, 13, 14, 7, 10] reflecting its importance in crisis response, and any supply can be requisitioned in unlimited quantities. The storage room has a maximum weight capacity 33 and a maximum volume capacity 18. The objective is to determine how many units of each supply to stock to maximize the total preparedness value without surpassing the room's structural and spatial limits, ensuring optimal readiness for patient care.

A humanitarian organization assembles nutritional parcels for distribution, where each food item has a weight [6, 4, 9, 4, 1, 7, 3, 6, 4, 7], a packed volume [5, 5, 5, 2, 5, 4, 1, 5, 4, 2], and a nutritional value score [4, 20, 8, 20, 7, 6, 10, 18, 6, 10], and items can be included in parcels without restriction. Each parcel container has a maximum allowable weight 30 and a fixed internal volume 22. The goal is to select the quantity of each food item per parcel to maximize the total nutritional benefit delivered, while adhering to the parcel's weight and size constraints for practical handling and shipping.

A film studio's property department must optimally store a vast collection of reusable props, where each prop category has a handling weight [9, 1, 10, 2, 2, 7, 3, 2, 8, 5], a storage footprint [2, 4, 1, 5, 4, 5, 4, 3, 4, 1], and a frequency-of-use value [13, 13, 6, 10, 9, 20, 5, 16, 6, 12], and any number of units from each category can be stored. The warehouse has a maximum floor load capacity 29 and a total cubic storage volume 19. The aim is to decide on the quantity of each prop type to store to maximize the overall utility for future productions, without exceeding the warehouse's physical limitations.

An engineer is designing a microgrid using various renewable energy components, where each component type has an installation weight [2, 5, 3, 4, 5, 7, 1, 7, 7, 7], a spatial requirement [4, 5, 4, 4, 4, 3, 4, 5, 4, 5], and an energy output value [12, 20, 3, 3, 10, 6, 20, 7, 7, 7], and components can be installed in unlimited numbers. The installation site has a maximum load-bearing capacity 28 and a limited area with a volume constraint 25. The challenge is to determine the number of each component to install to maximize total energy generation capacity while respecting the site's weight and space restrictions.

In textile manufacturing, a factory must choose how many rolls of each fabric type to process, where each fabric roll has a weight [8, 1, 9, 10, 1, 2, 10, 6, 10, 1], a storage volume [2, 1, 2, 2, 5, 4, 3, 4, 1, 3], and a profit contribution [19, 10, 15, 10, 9, 15, 3, 15, 1, 14] per roll, with an unlimited supply of each fabric type available. The factory's dyeing vats and storage area have a maximum weight capacity 34 and a maximum volume capacity 16. The objective is to determine the optimal quantity of each fabric roll to process to maximize total profit without surpassing the weight and volume constraints, thereby optimizing production throughput and material utilization.

A large-scale catering service must decide on the quantity of each beverage type to supply for an event, where each beverage case has a weight [2, 4, 2, 6, 8, 3, 8, 10, 7, 5], a physical volume [3, 2, 4, 5, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1, 3], and an estimated profit [11, 20, 8, 2, 19, 15, 7, 16, 4, 15] per case, and any beverage can be ordered in unlimited quantities. The service vehicle has a maximum payload 33 and a maximum storage volume 15. The aim is to select the number of cases for each beverage to maximize overall profit while ensuring the total load stays within the vehicle's weight and space limits, crucial for logistical efficiency and customer satisfaction.

A mining company needs to transport multiple types of modular equipment to a remote site, where each equipment unit has a weight [8, 7, 2, 7, 5, 8, 3, 7, 5, 6], a volume [1, 2, 2, 5, 1, 4, 2, 5, 3, 4], and an operational value [5, 11, 14, 8, 5, 12, 9, 6, 13, 4] representing its importance to initial production, and each type can be included multiple times. The transport aircraft has strict maximum weight 34 and cargo hold volume 17 restrictions. The problem is to determine how many units of each equipment type to load to maximize the total operational value delivered, without exceeding the aircraft's capacities, which is vital for the project's timely and effective start-up.
